sections.text:
79-206.Compulsory attendance; nonattendance lists; transmission to enforcement officers.

Each superintendent of a school district, using the list specified in section 79-205, shall (1) compare the names of the children enrolled with the last census report on file in his or her office from such district, (2) prepare a list of all children resident in such district under his or her jurisdiction who are not attending school as provided in section 79-201, and (3) transmit the list to the officer or officers in such district whose duty it is to enforce the provisions of such section.

SourceLaws 1901, c. 70, § 1, p. 454;Laws 1903, c. 95, § 1, p. 549;Laws 1905, c. 140, § 1, p. 575;Laws 1907, c. 131, § 1, p. 430;R.S.1913, § 6924;Laws 1919, c. 155, § 1, p. 346;Laws 1921, c. 53, § 1(f), p. 228;C.S.1922, § 6508d;C.S.1929, § 79-1904;R.S.1943, § 79-1911;Laws 1949, c. 256, § 14, p. 694;R.S.1943, (1994), § 79-208;Laws 1996, LB 900, § 10;Laws 1999, LB 272, § 26;Laws 2024, LB1329, § 13.
